fixes.name: Loss Ratio
fixes.dax_expression: SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Loss Amount]) / SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Inforce Premiums])
fixes.solution_explanation: Uses aggregation (SUM), so it should be a measure. Column references are fully qualified with the table name.

fixes.name: Decline Ratio
fixes.dax_expression: SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Declines]) / SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Submissions])
fixes.solution_explanation: Uses aggregation (SUM), so it should be a measure. Column references are fully qualified with the table name.

fixes.name: Hit Ratio
fixes.dax_expression: SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Issued]) / SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Submissions])
fixes.solution_explanation: Uses aggregation (SUM), so it should be a measure. Column references are fully qualified with the table name.

fixes.name: Efficiency Ratio
fixes.dax_expression: SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Quoted]) / SUM('Sheet1 (Insurance Mock Data)'[Submissions])
fixes.solution_explanation: Uses aggregation (SUM), so it should be a measure. Column references are fully qualified with the table name.

fixes.name: Constant
fixes.solution_explanation: Constant expression with no field references; implemented as a measure so it evaluates consistently in any filter context.
